FOR EDUCATIONAL USE ONLY

Sarla Verma and Others v Delhi Transport Corporation and Another

Supreme Court of India

15 April 2009

Case Analysis

Bench

R.V. Raveendran, Lokeshwar Singh Panta

Where Reported

2009 Indlaw SC 488; (2009) 6 SCC 121; (2009) 2 SCC (Cr) 1002; 2009 (3) ACC 708; AIR 2009 SC 3104; 2009 (3) ALD(SC) 83; 2009 (75) ALR 638; 2009 (3) AWC 2138; 2009 (162) DLT 278; 2009 (4) JCC 2760; 2009 (3) JhrCR(SC) 17; 2010 (2) KLT 802; 2009 (4) MLJ(SC) 997; 2009 (4) MPLJ 96; 2009 (155) PLR 22; 2009 (3) RCR(Civil) 77; 2009 (4) RLW 2785; 2009(6) SCALE 129; [2009] 5 S.C.R. 1098

Case Digest

Subject: Carriers & Transportation

Keywords: Computation Of Compensation, Principles Of Tort, Higher Multiplier, Lump Sum Payment, Non Obstante Clause, Assessment Of Damages, Statutory Recognition

Summary: Carriers & Transportation - Motor Vehicle Act, 1988 - (A) Whether the future prospects can be taken into account for determining the income of the deceased ? If so, whether pay revisions that occurred during the pendency of the claim proceedings or appeals therefrom should be taken into account? - Held, where the deceased was self-employed or was on a fixed salary (without provision for annual increments etc.), the courts will usually take only the actual income at the time of death - An addition of 50% of actual salary to the actual salary income of the deceased towards future prospects, where the deceased had a permanent job and was below 40 years - (B) Whether the deduction towards personal and living expenses of the deceased should be less than one-fourth? - Held, where the deceased was married, the deduction towards personal and living expenses of the deceased, should be one-third (1/3rd) where the number of dependent family members is 2 to 3, one-fourth (1/4th) where the number of dependant family members is 4 to 6, and one-fifth (1/5th) where the number of dependant family members exceed six - (C) Whether the High Court erred in taking the multiplier as 13? - Multiplier will be 15 having regard to the age of the deceased at the time of death (38 years) - Appellants will be entitled to the said sum of Rs.165, 246/- in addition to what is already awarded - Appeal partly allowed.

All Cases Cited
